body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #14411 ([wallet] Restore ability to list incoming transactions by label by ryanofsky)
* #14384 (Resolve validationinterface circular dependencies by 251Labs)
* #14358 ([logs] Fix a few log messages related to duration measurement by romanz)
* #14350 (Add WalletInfo class by promag)
* #14309 (Use non-throwing type-safe ChainType where possible by MarcoFalke)
* #14121 (Index for BIP 157 block filters by jimpo)
* #14035 (Utxoscriptindex by mgrychow)
* #13969 (Make sure all callers of LookupBlockIndex(...) check for nullptr before dereferencing (CBlockIndex*) by practicalswift)
* #13756 (wallet: -avoidreuse feature for improved privacy by kallewoof)
* #13612 (Qt: Only call tryGetBalances in pollBalanceChanged if the result will be used. by tecnovert)
* #13582 (Extract AppInitLoadBlockIndex from AppInitMain by Empact)
* #13430 (use IsBlockPruned() where appropriate by kallewoof)
* #13100 (gui: Add dynamic wallets support by promag)
* #12508 (IsAllFromMe by kallewoof)
* #11652 (Add missing locks: validation.cpp + related by practicalswift)
* #11634 (wallet: Add missing cs_wallet/cs_KeyStore locks to wallet by practicalswift)
* #9381 (Remove CWalletTx merging logic from AddToWallet by ryanofsky)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

The error from travis:
```
interfaces/wallet.cpp:109:23: error: calling function 'CheckFinalTx' requires holding mutex 'cs_main' exclusively [-Werror,-Wthread-safety-analysis]
    result.is_final = CheckFinalTx(*wtx.tx);
                      ^
1 error generated.
```

Added 2 more small commits d0af21fab95ee453a1fee4242ceb89ca79d568eb -> a10e919db4c9f37f0bb60fd62a232abf8bd3dede ([pr/wchain.1](https://github.com/ryanofsky/bitcoin/commits/pr/wchain.1) -> [pr/wchain.2](https://github.com/ryanofsky/bitcoin/commits/pr/wchain.2), [compare](https://github.com/ryanofsky/bitcoin/compare/pr/wchain.1...pr/wchain.2)) from #10973 to fix the thread safety warnings (which are harmless but treated like errors).
